intro: Goniophlebium mosenii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces a stinging sap that can cause irritation upon contact with the skin. Goniophlebium mosenii is often found in forests and along stream banks, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
